definitions: public spectacle where a matador faces and kills a bull in an arena
examples: The bullfight drew thousands of spectators to the arena
Traditional bullfights are held during summer festivals in Spain

definitions: professional performer who fights bulls in a bullring as entertainment
examples: The bullfighter wore a traditional embroidered costume called traje de luces
Young bullfighters train for years before their first public performance

definitions: traditional spectacle of fighting bulls practiced in Spain and Latin America
examples: Bullfighting remains controversial due to animal welfare concerns
The history of bullfighting dates back several centuries

definitions: large North American frog with deep croaking call found near water
examples: The bullfrog's loud croak echoed across the pond at night
American bullfrogs can grow up to eight inches long

definitions: small freshwater catfish with broad flat head and barbels around mouth
examples: We caught several bullheads while fishing in the muddy river
Bullheads are bottom feeders that hunt mostly at night

definitions: gold or silver in bulk form of bars or ingots before coinage
examples: The bank vault stored millions of dollars worth of gold bullion
Investors often buy bullion as protection against economic uncertainty

definitions: young bull or castrated male cattle raised for beef production
examples: The farmer separated the bullocks from the rest of the herd
These bullocks will be ready for market in six months

definitions: area where relief pitchers warm up during a baseball game
large open office area with multiple desks and minimal privacy
examples: The relief pitcher started warming up in the bullpen
The manager called for a left-handed pitcher from the bullpen
The entire marketing team works together in the bullpen
Working in a bullpen can be noisy and distracting

definitions: circular arena with tiered seating where bullfights are held as public spectacles
examples: The historic bullring in Seville holds over twelve thousand spectators
Tourists visited the famous bullring even during the off-season

definitions: person who uses strength or power to harm or intimidate weaker people
examples: The school bully took lunch money from younger students
Standing up to a bully requires courage and support

definitions: repeated aggressive behavior intended to hurt or control another person physically or emotionally
examples: The school implemented a zero-tolerance policy against bullying
Cyberbullying has become a serious problem among teenagers

definitions: solid wall built for defense especially along a waterfront
person or thing that acts as defense against something harmful or undesirable
examples: The ancient bulwark protected the harbor from enemy ships
Stone bulwarks lined the castle's outer perimeter
Free press serves as a bulwark against government corruption
The constitution acts as a bulwark of civil liberties

definitions: person without home or job who wanders from place to place
informal term for the buttocks or bottom
examples: The old bum asked passersby for spare change
Several bums gathered around the fire under the bridge
He fell hard and landed right on his bum
The toddler scooted across the floor on her bum

definitions: large hairy bee that makes a loud buzzing sound while collecting nectar
examples: A fat bumblebee buzzed from flower to flower in the garden
Bumblebees are important pollinators for tomatoes and blueberries

definitions: raised area on a surface or swelling on the body
light blow or collision between two things
examples: A large bump appeared on his forehead after the fall
The road had several bumps that made driving uncomfortable
She felt a bump when another car tapped her bumper
The boat gave a gentle bump against the dock

definitions: horizontal bar attached to front or rear of vehicle to absorb impact
examples: The car's rear bumper was dented in the parking lot accident
Modern bumpers contain sensors for parking assistance

definitions: small round sweet or plain bread roll often used for sandwiches
hairstyle where hair is drawn back and twisted into a knot
examples: She ordered a hamburger on a sesame seed bun
The bakery sold fresh cinnamon buns every morning
The ballet dancer wore her hair in a tight bun
She twisted her long hair into a messy bun

definitions: collection of things wrapped or fastened together for carrying
group of products or services sold together as single unit
examples: She carried a bundle of firewood into the cabin
The mailman delivered a bundle of letters tied with string
The software bundle included three programs for one price
Cable companies offer bundles with internet and phone service

definitions: business practice of selling multiple products or services together as one combined package
examples: Product bundling helped the company increase its average sale value
The bundling of cable channels frustrated customers wanting specific shows

definitions: stopper for closing the hole in a cask or barrel
examples: The winemaker removed the bung to sample the aging wine
A wooden bung sealed the opening in the whiskey barrel

definitions: low house having only one story or sometimes upper rooms set in the roof
examples: They bought a cozy bungalow in the suburbs with a large garden
The beach bungalow offered stunning views of the ocean

definitions: strong elastic cord used for securing luggage or for bungee jumping
examples: He secured the cargo with several bungee cords on the truck
The bungee snapped back when she released one end

definitions: work done badly or mistake made through incompetence or clumsiness
examples: The repair job was a complete bungle that made things worse
His bungle of the presentation cost the company the contract

definitions: narrow bed built like a shelf often in tiers
nonsensical or untrue talk or ideas
examples: The sailors slept in bunks stacked three high
Each child claimed the top bunk in their bedroom
His explanation was pure bunk that nobody believed
Don't believe that bunk about getting rich quickly

definitions: reinforced underground shelter designed to protect from bombs or attack
sand-filled hollow on a golf course designed as obstacle
examples: The soldiers took cover in the concrete bunker during shelling
Underground bunkers protected civilians during the air raids
His golf ball landed in the deep bunker beside the green
She practiced hitting out of bunkers at the driving range

definitions: informal or child's word for rabbit especially a young one
examples: The children squealed with delight when they saw the fluffy bunny
Peter's pet bunny loved eating fresh carrots and lettuce

definitions: gas burner used in laboratories producing single hot blue flame
examples: Students heated test tubes over the bunsen burner during chemistry class
Always turn off the bunsen when not actively using it

definitions: baseball hit made by holding bat steady and letting ball hit it
examples: The player executed a perfect bunt down the third base line
A sacrifice bunt advanced the runner to second base

definitions: strings of colorful flags or fabric used as festive decoration
small seed-eating songbird with stubby bill and colorful plumage
examples: Red, white and blue bunting decorated the street for Independence Day
The carnival entrance was draped with bright bunting
A painted bunting perched on the garden fence
Snow buntings migrate south during harsh winters

definitions: floating object anchored in water to mark channels or warn of hazards
examples: The red buoy marked the edge of the shipping channel
Sailors must navigate carefully between the buoys in foggy weather

definitions: tendency of object to float in water or rise in air
cheerful and optimistic attitude or quality that lifts spirits
examples: The life jacket's buoyancy kept the swimmer safely afloat
Engineers tested the buoyancy of the new boat design
Her natural buoyancy helped the team through difficult times
The comedian's buoyancy made everyone in the room smile

definitions: prickly seed case or flower head that clings to fur or clothing
examples: The dog's fur was covered with burs after running through the field
Hikers picked burs off their socks after the trail walk

definitions: system of government where decisions are made by state officials rather than elected representatives
excessively complicated administrative procedures often seen as obstacle to efficiency
examples: The federal bureaucracy employs millions of civil servants
Changes in bureaucracy require approval from multiple departments
Getting a building permit involved dealing with endless bureaucracy
Small businesses struggle with government bureaucracy and regulations

definitions: official in government department perceived as being concerned with procedural correctness
examples: The bureaucrat insisted on proper forms being filed in triplicate
Career bureaucrats often resist policy changes from new administrations

definitions: informal term for a city or town especially a small one
examples: He left the big city to live in a quiet burg upstate
This little burg has only one traffic light downtown

definitions: Scottish term for town or city especially one with a charter
examples: Edinburgh was granted burgh status by royal charter centuries ago
The ancient burgh held weekly markets in the town square

definitions: citizen of a town or city typically a member of the wealthy middle class
examples: The wealthy burghers built grand houses along the main street
Medieval burghers controlled trade within the city walls

definitions: person who illegally enters buildings to steal things
examples: The burglar entered through an unlocked window while they slept
Police caught the burglar with stolen jewelry in his bag

definitions: crime of illegally entering a building with intent to commit theft
examples: The neighborhood experienced several burglaries last month
Installing security cameras helped reduce burglary attempts

definitions: dark red color similar to red wine
red or white wine from the Burgundy region of France
examples: She chose a burgundy dress for the formal dinner
The walls were painted a rich burgundy color
They served an excellent burgundy with the beef dinner
This burgundy pairs well with mushroom dishes

definitions: ceremony of burying a dead body in a grave or tomb
examples: The burial took place at the family cemetery on the hillside
Ancient burial sites reveal much about past civilizations

definitions: rounded knotty growth on tree trunk valued for decorative wood grain
examples: The woodworker paid extra for the walnut burl's unique pattern
A large burl grew on the oak tree's trunk

definitions: coarse canvas woven from jute or hemp used for sacks
examples: Coffee beans arrived at the roastery in burlap sacks
They used burlap to protect young trees from winter frost

definitions: variety show featuring striptease dancing and comedy acts
absurd or comically exaggerated imitation of something serious
examples: The old theater once hosted famous burlesque shows
Modern burlesque combines dance artistry with theatrical performance
His speech was a burlesque of political rhetoric
The play was a burlesque of romantic melodramas

definitions: part of stove or furnace that produces flame or heat
examples: She turned the burner to low heat for simmering the sauce
The gas burner needed cleaning after the pot boiled over

definitions: enveloping outer garment worn by some Muslim women covering entire body
examples: She chose to wear a burqa when visiting conservative areas
The blue burqa provided complete coverage in public spaces

definitions: rough edge or ridge left on metal after cutting or drilling
rough pronunciation of the letter R in some accents
examples: He filed away the burr from the freshly cut pipe
Metal burrs can cause injuries if not removed properly
His Scottish burr made his speech distinctly recognizable
The actor practiced speaking with an authentic Irish burr

definitions: Mexican dish of tortilla wrapped around filling of beans, meat, and cheese
examples: He ordered a chicken burrito with extra guacamole for lunch
The breakfast burrito contained eggs, potatoes, and chorizo
